text.tspan: Comparison of version control and source code management tools:
Revision tracking: Arcane folder numbering schemes
Code sharing: Email, scp, snail mail printout
Revision tracking: Snapshots of code numbered sequentially
Revision tracking: changesets numbered, can be exchanged between
Code sharing: github Pull Requests and Fork Queue
Collaborative development tools: github code commenting system
In SVN, there is one repository and users have ``working copies''
between which there is no way to share patches. With git, everything
is a repository and code is easily shared between peers. Individual
commits can be pushed and pulled from one repository to another.
